quoteLast: . I read between London and Bangor the lives of the emperors from Maximin to Carinus, inclusive, in the Augustine history, and was greatly amused and interested." On board the steamer: "I put on my greatcoat and sat on deck during the whole voyage.

quoteFirst: At Saint Cloud, Madame was in the habit of taking a glass of endive- water, at
quoteTime: about seven o'clock in the evening
quoteLast: .  A servant of hers used to make it, and then put it away in a cupboard where there was some ordinary water for the use of Madame if she found the other too bitter.  The cupboard was in an antechamber which served as the public passage by which the apartments of Madame were reached.

quoteLast: , moving up to the north of Chambrecy.  The position was gained, the Wiltshires connecting up with the Cheshires on their right and the Gloucesters on their left.

quoteFirst: Otto, my poor father’s adored and only son, was seized by the destroying angel. His sufferings lasted the whole night and the next day, with alternations of hope and despair;
quoteLast: all was over. My father threw himself on the corpse with such a thrilling shriek that it pealed through the whole house. We could hardly tear him from the dead body. And oh! the cries of agony that now ensued; for hours and hours long the old man poured out howling, roaring, rattling shrieks of desperation.
title: Lay Down Your Arms: The Autobiography of Martha von Tilling

quoteFirst: On the 6th of March, 1776, being Weddensday,
quoteLast: , died of a linguring illness my (then) Eldest Daughter, Margaret, being 19 years 9 months and 11 days old, she had a Sollid Understanding, and without ostentation was firmly attached to the Cause of Truth, Virtue and Religion, Kind and Affectionate to her acquaintances but more especially to her Relations, and among her last words expressed her gratitude for the care they had taken of her, I believe her illness originated from a severe cold, which she contracted about 8 months presiding her death.
title: Trial of Deacon Brodie

quoteFirst: Six days later I left on Mendizabal’s horse, starting after breakfast at 7 a.m. It was nine leagues to Cuti, and all uphill. At
quoteLast: , when it was just dark, and the stars were out, but not the moon, I got off my horse to walk down a few yards for a drink of water, and not taking sufficient care and notice of the path I stepped over the side, and slid right down the steep bank, dragging the horse with me, till I fell up against a big rock with the horse against me.
title: Adventures in Bolivia

quoteFirst: Onwards they passed till at last they disappeared at the lower end of the Fell. In expectation of finding the man dashed to pieces by so tremendous a fall, they went early next morning and made a search, but no trace of man or horse, or the prints of their feet on the turf could be found. Sometime afterwards,
quoteLast: , on the same spot, they beheld a troop of horsemen advancing in close ranks and at a brisk pace. The inmates of every cottage for a mile round beheld the wondrous scene, though they had formerly ridiculed the story told by Mr. Wren and his servant, and were struck with surprise and fear.
title:
